short_summary: Providing relocation and installation services to Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) employees
description: Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) requires relocation and installation services for its employees. This contract will be a one (1) year period with the option to extend by three (3) option years. The services will be need to be performed by various buildings occupied by NRCan employees in the National Capital Region.
full_summary:
# National Capital Region (NCR) Relocation and Installation Services for Natural Resources Canada
## Tender Notice Advertisement

#### Solicitation Information

* **Solicitation Number:** NRCan-5000070118
* **Reference Number:** PW-22-01017909
* **Publication Date:** 2022-12-19
* **Closing Date and Time:** 2023-01-19 14:00:00 EST
* **Status:** Expired

#### Description of Goods and Services

The Government of Canada is seeking a contractor to provide relocation and installation services for Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) on an "as and when requested" basis for various buildings occupied by NRCan employees in the National Capital Region.

The main locations for this project include the Booth Street Complex, Bells Corners Complex, Anderson Road Complex, Observatory Crescent, 350 Albert Street, 2464 Sheffield Road, and 3484 Limebank Road. The contract duration is for one year with the option to extend by three additional years.

#### Terms and Conditions

This contract will be awarded through a competitive bidding process. Bidders must demonstrate their ability to meet the requirements outlined in the Request for Proposal (RFP) document.

The following trade agreements apply to this tender:

* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)

#### Requirements

Bidders must submit the following documentation:

* Proof of registration in the suppliers' directory
* A copy of their business license
* Proof of liability insurance
* Proof of workers' compensation insurance

#### Eligibility

Only suppliers who have a valid contract with Natural Resources Canada are eligible to participate in this tender.

#### Additional Resources

The Request for Proposal (RFP) document and attachments can be found in the Canada Buys portal.

**Note:**

* This tender is governed by the Contracting Entity: Natural Resources Canada.
* The end-users for this contract are Natural Resources Canada employees in the National Capital Region.

Contact Information:

 Phone: 343-543-7092
